ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: I feel out of place in the world because I have a mental illness.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree; -5= Skipped, -9= Not shown

ElementDescription: Having a mental illness has spoiled my life.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree; -5= Skipped, -9= Not shown

ElementDescription: People without mental illness could not possibly understand me.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree; -5= Skipped, -9= Not shown

ElementDescription: I am embarrassed or ashamed that I have a mental illness.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree; -5= Skipped, -9= Not shown

ElementDescription: I am disappointed in myself for having a mental illness.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree; -5= Skipped, -9= Not shown

ElementDescription: I feel inferior to others who don't have a mental illness.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree; -5= Skipped, -9= Not shown

ElementDescription: Stereotypes about the mentally ill apply to me.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree; -5= Skipped, -9= Not shown

ElementDescription: People can tell that I have a mental illness by the way I look.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree; -5= Skipped, -9= Not shown

ElementDescription: Mentally ill people tend to be violent.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree; -5= Skipped, -9= Not shown

ElementDescription: Because I have a mental illness, I need others to make most decisions for me.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree; -5= Skipped, -9= Not shown

ElementDescription: People with mental illness cannot live a good, rewarding life.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree; -5= Skipped, -9= Not shown

ElementDescription: Mentally ill people shouldn't get married.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree; -5= Skipped, -9= Not shown

ElementDescription: I can't contribute anything to society because I have a mental illness.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree; -5= Skipped, -9= Not shown

ElementDescription: People discriminate against me because I have a mental illness.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree; -5= Skipped, -9= Not shown

ElementDescription: Others think that I can't achieve much in life because I have a mental illness.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree; -5= Skipped, -9= Not shown

ElementDescription: People ignore me or take me less seriously just because I have a mental illness.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree; -5= Skipped, -9= Not shown

ElementDescription: People often patronize me or treat me like a child, just because I have a mental illness.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree; -5= Skipped, -9= Not shown

ElementDescription: Nobody would be interested in getting close to me because I have a mental illness.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree; -5= Skipped, -9= Not shown

ElementDescription: I don't talk about myself much because I don't want to burden others with my mental illness.

ElementDescription: I don't socialize as much as I used to because my mental illness might make me look or behave 'weird'.

ElementDescription: Negative stereotypes about mental illness keep me isolated from the 'normal' world.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree; -5= Skipped, -9= Not shown

ElementDescription: I stay away from social situations in order to protect my family or friends from embarrassment.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree; -5= Skipped, -9= Not shown

ElementDescription: Being around people who don't have a mental illness makes me feel out of place or inadequate.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree; -5= Skipped, -9= Not shown

ElementDescription: I avoid getting close to people who don't have a mental illness to avoid rejection.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree; -5= Skipped, -9= Not shown

ElementDescription: I feel comfortable being seen in public with an obviously mentally ill person.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree; -5= Skipped, -9= Not shown

ElementDescription: In general, I am able to live life the way I want to.
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree; -5= Skipped, -9= Not shown

ElementDescription: Alienation Score
Stereotype Endorsement Score
Discrimination Experience Score
Social Withdrawal Score
Stigma Resistance Score
My life experiences can help others
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: The way I live shows other people that stigma is wrong
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: I help others resist stigma by showing that I believe in them
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: I help others see they should not be ashamed
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: I share my story with others to combat stigma
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: I question the misinformation I hear from others on social media
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: Resisting stigma means speaking up when others say negative things
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: I advocate for better treatment for people like me
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: I believe teaching others is a way to fight stigma
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: I can have a positive view of myself even when others do not have a positive view of me
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: When I encounter stigma, I can think of why these attitudes are wrong
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: Resisting stigma means doing what I want to do, no matter what others think about me
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: I challenge negative thoughts that I have about myself
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: To resist stigma, I think about positive things about myself
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: I tell myself positive things to help resist stigma
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: I encourage others by showing them there is hope
Notes: 1= Strongly Disagree; 2= Disagree; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: Timepoint/visit label
Notes: e.g., Baseline, Morning, At Bedtime

ElementDescription: Most people feel that a child receiving mental health treatment is a sign of personal failure within a family.
Notes: 1 = Strongly Agree; 2 = Agree; 3 = Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4 = Disagree; 5 = Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: I will try all other options before contacting professional mental health services because I believe that my child and/or family would be treated differently by others.
Notes: 1 = Strongly Agree; 2 = Agree; 3 = Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4 = Disagree; 5 = Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: I will try to handle my child''s difficulties without help because I would be concerned that my child and/or family would be stigmatized for receiving mental health services.
Notes: 1 = Strongly Agree; 2 = Agree; 3 = Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4 = Disagree; 5 = Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: I would bring my child to mental health services only because I had no other options.
Notes: 1 = Strongly Agree; 2 = Agree; 3 = Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4 = Disagree; 5 = Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: I believe people with mental health problems are ''crazy''.
Notes: 1 = Strongly Agree; 2 = Agree; 3 = Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4 = Disagree; 5 = Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: I believe that there is something wrong with children who are in treatment for mental health problems.
Notes: 1 = Strongly Agree; 2 = Agree; 3 = Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4 = Disagree; 5 = Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: If one of my child''s friends was receiving mental health treatment, I wouldn''t want my child to play with them anymore.
Notes: 1 = Strongly Agree; 2 = Agree; 3 = Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4 = Disagree; 5 = Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: I think that people would think there is something wrong with my child if they knew he/she received mental health treatment.
Notes: 1 = Strongly Agree; 2 = Agree; 3 = Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4 = Disagree; 5 = Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: I would be reluctant to have my child seen by a mental health professional because I am concerned that others will think there is something wrong with my child and/or family.
Notes: 1 = Strongly Agree; 2 = Agree; 3 = Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4 = Disagree; 5 = Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: I believe that people would treat me and my family differently if they knew my child was receiving mental health treatment.
Notes: 1 = Strongly Agree; 2 = Agree; 3 = Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4 = Disagree; 5 = Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: I would be reluctant to tell people that my child is receiving mental health treatment because they may view my child and/or family differently.
Notes: 1 = Strongly Agree; 2 = Agree; 3 = Neither Agree nor Disagree; 4 = Disagree; 5 = Strongly Disagree

ElementDescription: Most people would willingly accept someone who has received mental health treatment as a close friend
Notes: 1=Strongly Disagree; 2=Disagree; 3=Somewhat Disagree; 4=Somewhat Agree; 5=Agree; 6=Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: Most people feel that receiving mental health treatment is a sign of personal failure
Notes: 1=Strongly Disagree; 2=Disagree; 3=Somewhat Disagree; 4=Somewhat Agree; 5=Agree; 6=Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: Most people think less of a person who has received mental health treatment
Notes: 1=Strongly Disagree; 2=Disagree; 3=Somewhat Disagree; 4=Somewhat Agree; 5=Agree; 6=Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: Once they know a person was in a mental hospital for mental health problems, most people will take his or her opinions less seriously.

ElementDescription: Most people believe that entering a mental hospital is a sign of personal failure.

ElementDescription: Most people would not hire someone who has had mental health problems to take care of their children, even if he or she had been well for some time.
